TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Configures a timeout that helps mitigate denial of service attacks by terminating any request that takes longer than the <xref:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement.ReadTimeout%2A> property value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The timeout value is checked on every call to <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 readTimeout) cil managed

Docs.param: The value of the timeout period.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the provided <xref:System.Int32> value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 readTimeout, bool strict) cil managed

Docs.param: The time to wait before terminating requests to <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent%2A>.

Whether to throw an exception if the serializer encounters elements or attributes that were not in the original schema. For details, see the <xref:System.Web.Services.Configuration.SoapEnvelopeProcessingElement.IsStrict%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the timeout period used to determine whether to terminate requests to mitigate against denial of service attacks.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to throw an exception if the serializer encounters unexpected elements or attributes.
Docs.value: if the Web services serializer tries to detect unexpected elements or attributes; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set the IsStrict property to `true` in order to help debug interoperation scenarios. In general, when the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class meets an element or attribute that it does not expect it raises an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnknownNode> event and continues processing. (The same is true when the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlArrayAttribute.Order%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlElementAttribute.Order%2A>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAnyElementAttribute.Order%2A> properties are used but data is sent out of order.) Setting the IsStrict property to `true` instructs the Web services run time to handle that event and throw a <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that contains a list of the expected elements and attributes.
> [!NOTE] > Because exceptions are not thrown for all unexpected elements and attributes, the IsStrict property should not be relied upon except as a debugging aid. For example, unexpected `xml:lang` and `xml:space` attributes may not cause an exception.

Docs.returns: if the Web services serializer tries to detect unexpected elements or attributes; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the timeout period used to determine whether to terminate requests to mitigate against denial of service attacks.
Docs.value: The time to wait before terminating requests to <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent%2A>.
Docs.returns: The time to wait before terminating requests to <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent%2A>.
